result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph A. DVORAK was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Ordinary confinement, concurrent with 15 CM 144 and 15 CM 172.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph A. DVORAK

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.
GUILTY plea entered to count 1, bail jumping.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in count 2.  Motion granted.
The defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for ninety (90) days, Ordinary Confinement, concurrent with 15 CM 144 and 15 CM 172.  
Defendant has 57 days credit.
$443.00 court costs imposed.  The Court orders these costs remitted.  The $550.00 cash bail on file was applied to the costs on the other cases and any balances also remitted.
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.   
Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 04-17-15 at 4:00 p.m.  Plea date is set for 06-30-15 at 2:30 p.m.  
Defense counsel argues for a modification of bail.  State objects.  Court denies the request for modification of bail.  
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.   
The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 04-06-15 at 1:30 p.m.   Bail is set at $500.00 cash with the condition that defendant must report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 24 hours of release and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Bai not furnished.  Defendant remanded to the county jail.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.   Copy filed.    
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.   
Minutes.
